p: Although extreme Q is theoretically achievable, the count rates at very high and very low Q are negligible because of the guide design (see Fig. 3 ▸). Also, these ranges are valid for the sample changer where there is no physical obstruction from the device and may not be achievable for all sample environments. In Figs. 4 ▸( a) and 4( b), data sets for the four standard wavelength settings from a sample that has a long d-spacing peak (CsLaNb 2O 7) are shown. A zoomed-in region of the data clearly shows how resolution and intensities can vary from data collected for the same amount of time.
